cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles N of Great Inagua Island
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest across the Bahamas, then turning northwest toward south Florida and tracking up the Florida west coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Florida – Florida Keys to Naples area

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Bonita Beach to Anna Maria Island (includes Port Manatee/Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None for this segment (Hurricane Warning now south of Bonita Beach; Storm Surge Watch north of Bonita Beach to Venice)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida peninsula Gulf Coast from Bonita Beach northward through Tampa Bay, including Manatee County Port
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood of tropical-storm winds and a moderate (≈40%) chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible late Sunday into early Monday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft of surge possible along the lower and central Tampa Bay coastline, higher if the eye tracks just offshore
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with isolated totals up to 10 inches could trigger flash flooding in and around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large, destructive waves in Tampa Bay, dangerous seas hampering vessel movements, and isolated tornadoes in rainbands
